field.name: summary
field.value: Failing resolution of proxied components implementing multiple generic service interfaces

field.name: description
field.value:
Resolution of a proxied open generic component implementing multiple generic service interfaces and registered with all these interfaces (e.g. ExtendedGenericServiceImpl<T> in the attached test case), leads to an exception. I've digged a little and the trouble seems to originate from DefaultGenericHandler.BuildSubHandler method, which creates a new component model having only the requested type as a service. This leads to have the first handler cached and used in following resolutions. This behavior can be observed in the test case I've attached, specifically has to be noted that while the test "Dependency_resolution_generic_proxy_should_implement_all_services" fails because in TestComponent constructor I've forced the less specific service to be resolved first, the test "Generic_handler_caching_should_not_affect_resolution" does NOT fail because of there the most specific service is resolved first.
This issue did not arose in a project using Windsor 2.5.2 version, until I updated to 3.0.
This is my first issue submission for this project, so I'm sorry for any formal divergence from your standards and conventions, especially in the attached test case.
Best regards, Andrea Montemaggio
